data.title: Emergent Bartering Behaviour in Multi-Agent Reinforcement Learning
data.description: In our recent paper, we explore how populations of deep reinforcement learning (deep RL) agents can learn microeconomic behaviours, such as production, consumption, and trading of goods. We find that artificial agents learn to make economically rational decisions about production, consumption, and prices, and react appropriately to supply and demand changes.

data.description: We understand speech input better if we have some background on the topic of conversation. Consider a customer service agent at an auto parts wholesaler helping with orders. If the agent knows that the customer is looking for tires, they’re more likely to recognize responses (for example, “Michelin”) on the phone. Agents often pick up […]
